public/auth.description:
Retrieve an Oauth access token, to be used for authentication of 'private' requests.
Three methods of authentication are supported:
- `client_credentials` - using the access key and access secret that can be found on the API page on the website
- `client_signature` - using the access key that can be found on the API page on the website and user generated signature. The signature is calculated using some fields provided in the request, using formula described here [Deribit signature credentials](https://docs.deribit.com/#additional-authorization-method-signature-credentials-websocket-api)
- `refresh_token` - using a refresh token that was received from an earlier invocation
The response will contain an access token, expiration period (number of seconds that the token is valid) and a refresh token that can be used to get a new set of tokens.

timestamp.description: Required for grant type `client_signature`, provides time when request has been generated (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

signature.description: Required for grant type `client_signature`; it's a cryptographic signature calculated over provided fields using user __secret key__. The signature should be calculated as an HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) with `SHA256` hash algorithm

nonce.description: Optional for grant type `client_signature`; delivers user generated initialization vector for the server token

data.description: Optional for grant type `client_signature`; contains any user specific value

state.description: Will be passed back in the response

scope.description:
Describes type of the access for assigned token, possible values: `connection`, `session:name`, `trade:[read, read_write, none]`, `wallet:[read, read_write, none]`, `account:[read, read_write, none]`, `expires:NUMBER`, `ip:ADDR`.

 Details are elucidated in [Access scope](https://docs.deribit.com/#access-scope)

refresh_token.description: Can be used to request a new token (with a new lifetime)

scope.description: Type of the access for assigned token

state.description: Copied from the input (if applicable)

private/logout.description: Gracefully close websocket connection, when COD (Cancel On Disconnect) is enabled orders are not cancelled

invalidate_token.description: If value is `true` all tokens created in current session are invalidated, default: `true`

public/set_heartbeat.description: Signals the Websocket connection to send and request heartbeats. Heartbeats can be used to detect stale connections. When heartbeats have been set up, the API server will send `heartbeat` messages and `test_request` messages. Your software should respond to `test_request` messages by sending a `/api/v2/public/test` request. If your software fails to do so, the API server will immediately close the connection. If your account is configured to cancel on disconnect, any orders opened over the connection will be cancelled.

interval.description: The heartbeat interval in seconds, but not less than 10

response.description: Result of method execution. `ok` in case of success
Result of method execution. `ok` in case of success

private/enable_cancel_on_disconnect.description:
Enable Cancel On Disconnect for the connection. After enabling Cancel On Disconnect all orders created by the connection will be removed when connection is closed. 

 __NOTICE__ It does not affect orders created by other connections - they will remain active !

 When change is applied for the account, then every newly opened connection will start with __active__ Cancel on Disconnect.

scope.description:
Specifies if Cancel On Disconnect change should be applied/checked for the current connection or the account (default - `connection`)

 __NOTICE:__ Scope `connection` can be used only when working via Websocket.

response.description: Result of method execution. `ok` in case of success

private/disable_cancel_on_disconnect.description:
Disable Cancel On Disconnect for the connection.

 When change is applied for the account, then every newly opened connection will start with __inactive__ Cancel on Disconnect.

scope.description:
Specifies if Cancel On Disconnect change should be applied/checked for the current connection or the account (default - `connection`)

 __NOTICE:__ Scope `connection` can be used only when working via Websocket.

response.description: Result of method execution. `ok` in case of success

private/get_cancel_on_disconnect.description: Read current Cancel On Disconnect configuration for the account.

Informs if Cancel on Disconnect was checked for the current connection or the account

public/get_time.description: Retrieves the current time (in milliseconds). This API endpoint can be used to check the clock skew between your software and Deribit's systems.

response.description: Current timestamp (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

public/hello.description: Method used to introduce the client software connected to Deribit platform over websocket. Provided data may have an impact on the maintained connection and will be collected for internal statistical purposes. In response, Deribit will also introduce itself.

public/status.description: Method used to get information about locked currencies

locked.description: `true` when platform is locked in all currencies, `partial` when some currencies are locked, `false` - when there are not currencies locked

locked_currencies.description: List of currencies in which platform is locked

public/test.description: Tests the connection to the API server, and returns its version. You can use this to make sure the API is reachable, and matches the expected version.

expected_result.description: The value "exception" will trigger an error response. This may be useful for testing wrapper libraries.

public/subscribe.description:
Subscribe to one or more channels.
This is the same method as [/private/subscribe](https://docs.deribit.com/#private_subscribe), but it can only be used for 'public' channels.

response.description: A list of subscribed channels.

public/unsubscribe.description: Unsubscribe from one or more channels.

channels.description: A list of channels to unsubscribe from.

response.description: A list of subscribed channels.

public/unsubscribe_all.description: Unsubscribe from all the channels subscribed so far.

response.description: Result of method execution. `ok` in case of success

private/subscribe.description:

The name of the channel determines what information will be provided, and in what form.

private/execute_block_trade.description:
Creates block trade

The whole request have to be exact the same as in `private/verify_block_trade`, only role field should be set appropriately - it basically means that both sides have to agree on the same timestamp, nonce, trades fields and server will assure that role field is different between sides (each party accepted own role).

 Using the same timestamp and nonce by both sides in `private/verify_block_trade` assures that even if unintentionally both sides execute given block trade with valid counterparty_signature, the given block trade will be executed only once.

private/buy.description: Places a buy order for an instrument.

amount.description: It represents the requested order size. For perpetual and futures the amount is in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH

label.description: user defined label for the order (maximum 64 characters)

price.description:
The order price in base currency (Only for limit and stop_limit orders)

 When adding order with advanced=usd, the field price should be the option price value in USD.

 When adding order with advanced=implv, the field price should be a value of implied volatility in percentages. For example,  price=100, means implied volatility of 100%

time_in_force.description:
Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Default `"good_til_cancelled"`

 - `"good_til_cancelled"` - unfilled order remains in order book until cancelled
- `"good_til_day"` - unfilled order remains in order book till the end of the trading session
- `"fill_or_kill"` - execute a transaction immediately and completely or not at all
- `"immediate_or_cancel"` - execute a transaction immediately, and any portion of the order that cannot be immediately filled is cancelled

max_show.description: Maximum amount within an order to be shown to other customers, `0` for invisible order

post_only.description:
If true, the order is considered post-only. If the new price would cause the order to be filled immediately (as taker), the price will be changed to be just below the spread.

 Only valid in combination with time_in_force=`"good_til_cancelled"`

reject_post_only.description:
If an order is considered post-only and this field is set to true then the order is put to order book unmodified or request is rejected.

 Only valid in combination with `"post_only"` set to true

reduce_only.description: If `true`, the order is considered reduce-only which is intended to only reduce a current position

trigger_price.description: Trigger price, required for trigger orders only (Stop-loss or Take-profit orders)

trigger_offset.description: The maximum deviation from the price peak beyond which the order will be triggered

trigger.description: Defines the trigger type. Required for `"Stop-Loss"`, `"Take-Profit"` and `"Trailing"` trigger orders

advanced.description: Advanced option order type. (Only for options)

mmp.description: Order MMP flag, only for order_type 'limit'

valid_until.description: Timestamp, when provided server will start processing request in Matching Engine only before given timestamp, in other cases `timed_out` error will be responded. Remember that the given timestamp should be consistent with the server's time, use [/public/time](https://docs.deribit.com/#public-get_time) method to obtain current server time.

advanced.description: Advanced option order type. If you have posted an advanced option order, it is necessary to re-supply this parameter when editing it (Only for options)

trigger_price.description: Trigger price, required for trigger orders only (Stop-loss or Take-profit orders)

mmp.description: Order MMP flag, only for order_type 'limit'

valid_until.description: Timestamp, when provided server will start processing request in Matching Engine only before given timestamp, in other cases `timed_out` error will be responded. Remember that the given timestamp should be consistent with the server's time, use [/public/time](https://docs.deribit.com/#public-get_time) method to obtain current server time.

reject_post_only.description: `true` if order has `reject_post_only` flag (field is present only when `post_only` is `true`)

triggered.description: Whether the trigger order has been triggered

block_trade.description: `true` if order made from block_trade trade, added only in that case.

auto_replaced.description: Options, advanced orders only - `true` if last modification of the order was performed by the pricing engine, otherwise `false`.

last_update_timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

replaced.description: `true` if the order was edited (by user or - in case of advanced options orders - by pricing engine), otherwise `false`.

average_price.description: Average fill price of the order

label.description: User defined label (up to 64 characters)

is_liquidation.description: `true` if order was automatically created during liquidation

profit_loss.description: Profit and loss in base currency.

iv.description: Option implied volatility for the price (Option only)

liquidation.description: Optional field (only for trades caused by liquidation): `"M"` when maker side of trade was under liquidation, `"T"` when taker side was under liquidation, `"MT"` when both sides of trade were under liquidation

private/get_user_trades_by_currency_and_.description: Retrieve the latest user trades that have occurred for instruments in a specific currency symbol and within given time range.

kind.description: Instrument kind, if not provided instruments of all kinds are considered

start_timestamp.description: The earliest timestamp to return result for (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

end_timestamp.description: The most recent timestamp to return result for (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

include_old.description: Include trades older than a few recent days, default - `false`

sorting.description: Direction of results sorting (`default` value means no sorting, results will be returned in order in which they left the database)

amount.description: Trade amount. For perpetual and futures - in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

block_trade_id.description: Block trade id - when trade was part of block trade

fee.description: User's fee in units of the specified `fee_currency`

index_price.description: Index Price at the moment of trade

iv.description: Option implied volatility for the price (Option only)

label.description: User defined label (presented only when previously set for order by user)

liquidation.description: Optional field (only for trades caused by liquidation): `"M"` when maker side of trade was under liquidation, `"T"` when taker side was under liquidation, `"MT"` when both sides of trade were under liquidation

liquidity.description: Describes what was role of users order: `"M"` when it was maker order, `"T"` when it was taker order

mark_price.description: Mark Price at the moment of trade

matching_id.description: Always `null`, except for a self-trade which is possible only if self-trading is switched on for the account (in that case this will be id of the maker order of the subscriber)

order_id.description: Id of the user order (maker or taker), i.e. subscriber's order id that took part in the trade

profit_loss.description: Profit and loss in base currency.

self_trade.description: `true` if the trade is against own order. This can only happen when your account has self-trading enabled. Contact an administrator if you think you need that

state.description: Order state: `"open"`, `"filled"`, `"rejected"`, `"cancelled"`, `"untriggered"` or `"archive"` (if order was archived)

tick_direction.description: Direction of the "tick" (`0` = Plus Tick, `1` = Zero-Plus Tick, `2` = Minus Tick, `3` = Zero-Minus Tick).

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the trade (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

trade_seq.description: The sequence number of the trade within instrument

underlying_price.description: Underlying price for implied volatility calculations (Options only)

public/get_book_summary_by_currency.description: Retrieves the summary information such as open interest, 24h volume, etc. for all instruments for the currency (optionally filtered by kind).

kind.description: Instrument kind, if not provided instruments of all kinds are considered

ask_price.description: The current best ask price, `null` if there aren't any asks

bid_price.description: The current best bid price, `null` if there aren't any bids

creation_timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

estimated_delivery_price.description: Estimated delivery price for the market. For more details, see Contract Specification > General Documentation > Expiration Price

interest_rate.description: Interest rate used in implied volatility calculations (options only)

last.description: The price of the latest trade, `null` if there weren't any trades

low.description: Price of the 24h lowest trade, `null` if there weren't any trades

mark_price.description: The current instrument market price

mid_price.description: The average of the best bid and ask, `null` if there aren't any asks or bids

open_interest.description: The total amount of outstanding contracts in the corresponding amount units. For perpetual and futures the amount is in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

price_change.description: 24-hour price change expressed as a percentage, `null` if there weren't any trades

underlying_index.description: Name of the underlying future, or `'index_price'` (options only)

underlying_price.description: underlying price for implied volatility calculations (options only)

volume.description: The total 24h traded volume (in base currency)

volume_usd.description: [DEPRECATED] Volume in usd, use 'notional_volume' instead, available only for instruments with USD as quote currency

public/get_book_summary_by_instrument.description: Retrieves the summary information such as open interest, 24h volume, etc. for a specific instrument.

ask_price.description: The current best ask price, `null` if there aren't any asks

bid_price.description: The current best bid price, `null` if there aren't any bids

estimated_delivery_price.description: Estimated delivery price for the market. For more details, see Contract Specification > General Documentation > Expiration Price

low.description: Price of the 24h lowest trade, `null` if there weren't any trades

mark_price.description: The current instrument market price

mid_price.description: The average of the best bid and ask, `null` if there aren't any asks or bids

open_interest.description: The total amount of outstanding contracts in the corresponding amount units. For perpetual and futures the amount is in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

price_change.description: 24-hour price change expressed as a percentage, `null` if there weren't any trades

underlying_index.description: Name of the underlying future, or `'index_price'` (options only)

underlying_price.description: underlying price for implied volatility calculations (options only)

volume.description: The total 24h traded volume (in base currency)

volume_usd.description: [DEPRECATED] Volume in usd, use 'notional_volume' instead, available only for instruments with USD as quote currency

public/get_contract_size.description: Retrieves contract size of provided instrument.

contract_size.description: Contract size, for futures in USD, for options in base currency of the instrument (BTC, ETH, ...)

public/get_currencies.description: Retrieves all cryptocurrencies supported by the API.

currency.description: The abbreviation of the currency. This abbreviation is used elsewhere in the API to identify the currency.

currency_long.description: The full name for the currency.

min_confirmations.description: Minimum number of block chain confirmations before deposit is accepted.

min_withdrawal_fee.description: The minimum transaction fee paid for withdrawals

withdrawal_fee.description: The total transaction fee paid for withdrawals

public/get_delivery_prices.description: Retrives delivery prices for then given index

index_name.description: Index identifier, matches (base) cryptocurrency with quote currency

date.description: The event date with year, month and day

delivery_price.description: The settlement price for the instrument. Only when `state = closed`

public/get_funding_chart_data.description: Retrieve the latest user trades that have occurred for PERPETUAL instruments in a specific currency symbol and within given time range.

length.description: Specifies time period. `8h` - 8 hours, `24h` - 24 hours, `1m` - 1 month

index_price.description: Current index price

timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

public/get_historical_volatility.description: Provides information about historical volatility for given cryptocurrency.

public/get_index.description: Retrieves the current index price for the instruments, for the selected currency.

BTC.description: The current index price for BTC-USD (only for selected currency == BTC)

ETH.description: The current index price for ETH-USD (only for selected currency == ETH)

edp.description: Estimated delivery price for the currency. For more details, see Documentation > General > Expiration Price

public/get_index_price.description: Retrieves the current index price value for given index name.

index_name.description: Index identifier, matches (base) cryptocurrency with quote currency

estimated_delivery_price.description: Estimated delivery price for the market. For more details, see Documentation > General > Expiration Price

index_price.description: Value of requested index

public/get_index_price_names.description: Retrieves the identifiers of all supported Price Indexes

creation_timestamp.description: The time when the instrument was first created (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

expiration_timestamp.description: The time when the instrument will expire (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

is_active.description: Indicates if the instrument can currently be traded.

leverage.description: Maximal leverage for instrument, for futures only

min_trade_amount.description: Minimum amount for trading. For perpetual and futures - in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

price_index.description: Name of price index that is used for this instrument

quote_currency.description: The currency in which the instrument prices are quoted.

tick_size.description: specifies minimal price change and, as follows, the number of decimal places for instrument prices

public/get_instruments.description: Retrieves available trading instruments. This method can be used to see which instruments are available for trading, or which instruments have recently expired.

kind.description: Instrument kind, if not provided instruments of all kinds are considered

expired.description: Set to true to show recently expired instruments instead of active ones.

expiration_timestamp.description: The time when the instrument will expire (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

leverage.description: Maximal leverage for instrument, for futures only

min_trade_amount.description: Minimum amount for trading. For perpetual and futures - in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

price_index.description: Name of price index that is used for this instrument

quote_currency.description: The currency in which the instrument prices are quoted.

tick_size.description: specifies minimal price change and, as follows, the number of decimal places for instrument prices

public/get_mark_price_history.description: Public request for 5min history of markprice values for the instrument. For now the markprice history is available only for a subset of options which take part in the volatility index calculations. All other instruments, futures and perpetuals will return empty list.

start_timestamp.description: The earliest timestamp to return result for (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

end_timestamp.description: The most recent timestamp to return result for (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

response.description: Markprice history values as an array of arrays with 2 values each. The inner values correspond to the timestamp in ms and the markprice itself.

public/get_order_book.description: Retrieves the order book, along with other market values for a given instrument.

instrument_name.description: The instrument name for which to retrieve the order book, see [`public/get_instruments`](https://docs.deribit.com/#public-get_instruments) to obtain instrument names.

depth.description: The number of entries to return for bids and asks.

ask_iv.description: (Only for option) implied volatility for best ask

best_ask_amount.description: It represents the requested order size of all best asks

best_ask_price.description: The current best ask price, `null` if there aren't any asks

best_bid_amount.description: It represents the requested order size of all best bids

best_bid_price.description: The current best bid price, `null` if there aren't any bids

bid_iv.description: (Only for option) implied volatility for best bid

delivery_price.description: The settlement price for the instrument. Only when `state = closed`

delta.description: (Only for option) The delta value for the option

gamma.description: (Only for option) The gamma value for the option

rho.description: (Only for option) The rho value for the option

theta.description: (Only for option) The theta value for the option

vega.description: (Only for option) The vega value for the option

index_price.description: Current index price

interest_rate.description: Interest rate used in implied volatility calculations (options only)

last_price.description: The price for the last trade

book.{instrument_name}.{group}.{depth}.{.description: Notifies about changes to the order book for a certain instrument. Notifications are sent once per specified interval, with prices grouped by (rounded to) the specified group, showing the complete order book to the specified depth (number of price levels). The 'asks' and the 'bids' elements in the response are both a 'list of lists'. Each element in the outer list is a list of exactly two elements: price and amount. price is a price level (USD per BTC, rounded as specified by the 'group' parameter for the susbcription). amount indicates the amount of all orders at price level. For perpetual and futures the amount is in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

group.description:
Group prices (by rounding). Use `none` for no grouping.
 For ETH cryptocurrency, real `group` is divided by 100.0, e.g. given value `5` means using `0.05`

 Allowed values for BTC - `none`, `1`, `2`, `5`, `10`
 Allowed values for ETH - `none`, `5`, `10`, `25`, `100`, `250`

depth.description: Number of price levels to be included.

interval.description: Frequency of notifications. Events will be aggregated over this interval.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of last change (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

book.{instrument_name}.{interval}.description:
Notifies about changes to the order book for a certain instrument.
The first notification will contain the whole book (bid and ask amounts for all prices). After that there will only be information about changes to individual price levels.
The first notification will contain the amounts for all price levels (list of `['new', price, amount]` tuples). All following notifications will contain a list of tuples with action, price level and new amount (`[action, price, amount]`). Action can be either `new`, `change` or `delete`. 
Each notification will contain a `change_id` field, and each message except for the first one will contain a field `prev_change_id`. If `prev_change_id` is equal to the `change_id` of the previous message, this means that no messages have been missed.
The amount for perpetual and futures is in USD units, for options it is in corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

interval.description: Frequency of notifications. Events will be aggregated over this interval.

asks.description: The first notification will contain the amounts for all price levels (a list of ["new", price, amount] tuples). All following notifications will contain a list of tuples with action, price level and new amount ([action, price, amount]). Action can be `new`, `change` or `delete`.

prev_change_id.description: Identifier of the previous notification (it's __not__ included for the first notification)

timestamp.description: The timestamp of last change (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

type.description: Type of notification: `snapshot` for initial, `change` for others. The field is only included in aggregated response (when input parameter `interval` != `raw`)

Publicly available market data used to generate a TradingView candle chart. During single resolution period, many events can be sent, each with updated values for the recent period.

 __NOTICE__ When there is no trade during the requested resolution period (e.g. 1 minute), then filling sample is generated which uses data from the last available trade candle (open and close values).

low.description: The lowest price level for the candle

open.description: The open price for the candle'

ip.description: IP address of source that generated action

log.description: Action description, values: `changed_email` - email was changed; `changed_password` - password was changed; `disabled_tfa` - TFA was disabled; `enabled_tfa` - TFA was enabled, `success` - successful login; `failure` - login failure; `enabled_subaccount_login` - login was enabled for subaccount (in `data` - subaccount uid); `disabled_subaccount_login` - login was disabled for subbaccount (in `data` - subbacount uid);`new_api_key` - API key was created (in `data` key client id); `removed_api_key` - API key was removed (in `data` key client id); `changed_scope` - scope of API key was changed (in `data` key client id); `changed_whitelist` - whitelist of API key was edited (in `data` key client id); `disabled_api_key` - API key was disabled (in `data` key client id); `enabled_api_key` - API key was enabled (in `data` key client id); `reset_api_key` - API key was reset (in `data` key client id)

timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

user.changes.{instrument_name}.{interval.description: Get notifications about user's updates related to order, trades, etc. in an instrument.

interval.description: Frequency of notifications. Events will be aggregated over this interval. The value `raw` means no aggregation will be applied

mmp_cancelled.description: `true` if order was cancelled by mmp trigger (optional)

max_show.description: Maximum amount within an order to be shown to other traders, 0 for invisible order.

reject_post_only.description: `true` if order has `reject_post_only` flag (field is present only when `post_only` is `true`)

amount.description: It represents the requested order size. For perpetual and futures the amount is in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

advanced.description: advanced type: `"usd"` or `"implv"` (Only for options; field is omitted if not applicable).

triggered.description: Whether the trigger order has been triggered

block_trade.description: `true` if order made from block_trade trade, added only in that case.

trigger_offset.description: The maximum deviation from the price peak beyond which the order will be triggered (Only for trailing trigger orders)

auto_replaced.description: Options, advanced orders only - `true` if last modification of the order was performed by the pricing engine, otherwise `false`.

last_update_timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

replaced.description: `true` if the order was edited (by user or - in case of advanced options orders - by pricing engine), otherwise `false`.

filled_amount.description: Filled amount of the order. For perpetual and futures the filled_amount is in USD units, for options - in units or corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

average_price.description: Average fill price of the order

commission.description: Commission paid so far (in base currency)

app_name.description: The name of the application that placed the order on behalf of the user (optional).

label.description: User defined label (up to 64 characters)

trigger_order_id.description: Id of the trigger order that created the order (Only for orders that were created by triggered orders).

trigger_price.description: Trigger price (Only for future trigger orders)

creation_timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

is_liquidation.description: `true` if order was automatically created during liquidation

profit_loss.description: Profit and loss in base currency.

trigger_reference_price.description: The price of the given trigger at the time when the order was placed (Only for trailing trigger orders)

trigger.description: Trigger type (only for trigger orders). Allowed values: `"index_price"`, `"mark_price"`, `"last_price"`.

average_price.description: Average price of trades that built this position

average_price_usd.description: Only for options, average price in USD

floating_profit_loss_usd.description: Only for options, floating profit or loss in USD

index_price.description: Current index price

leverage.description: Current available leverage for future position

mark_price.description: Current mark price for position's instrument

realized_funding.description: Realized Funding in current session included in session realized profit or loss, only for positions of perpetual instruments

settlement_price.description: Last settlement price for position's instrument 0 if instrument wasn't settled yet

size.description: Position size for futures size in quote currency (e.g. USD), for options size is in base currency (e.g. BTC)

size_currency.description: Only for futures, position size in base currency

amount.description: Trade amount. For perpetual and futures - in USD units, for options it is amount of corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

block_trade_id.description: Block trade id - when trade was part of block trade

fee.description: User's fee in units of the specified `fee_currency`

index_price.description: Index Price at the moment of trade

iv.description: Option implied volatility for the price (Option only)

label.description: User defined label (presented only when previously set for order by user)

liquidation.description: Optional field (only for trades caused by liquidation): `"M"` when maker side of trade was under liquidation, `"T"` when taker side was under liquidation, `"MT"` when both sides of trade were under liquidation

liquidity.description: Describes what was role of users order: `"M"` when it was maker order, `"T"` when it was taker order

mark_price.description: Mark Price at the moment of trade

matching_id.description: Always `null`, except for a self-trade which is possible only if self-trading is switched on for the account (in that case this will be id of the maker order of the subscriber)

order_id.description: Id of the user order (maker or taker), i.e. subscriber's order id that took part in the trade

profit_loss.description: Profit and loss in base currency.

self_trade.description: `true` if the trade is against own order. This can only happen when your account has self-trading enabled. Contact an administrator if you think you need that

state.description: Order state: `"open"`, `"filled"`, `"rejected"`, `"cancelled"`, `"untriggered"` or `"archive"` (if order was archived)

tick_direction.description: Direction of the "tick" (`0` = Plus Tick, `1` = Zero-Plus Tick, `2` = Minus Tick, `3` = Zero-Minus Tick).

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the trade (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

trade_seq.description: The sequence number of the trade within instrument

underlying_price.description: Underlying price for implied volatility calculations (Options only)
